name: Southern Smothered Pork Chops in Brown Gravy
author: TXRachel
summary: Southern comfort food at its easiest. Pork chops smothered in onion, garlic, baby bella mushrooms, and a brown gravy sauce. Tastes great as gravy on mashed potatoes too!
ingredients: 1 ½ cups sliced baby bella mushrooms, or more to taste
½ teaspoon salt, or to taste
¼ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste
directions: Melt butter in a 3-quart saucepan over medium-low heat
Cook onion and garlic in the butter, stirring occasionally, until is browned, 7 to 10 minutes
Remove onion and garlic and set aside
Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until flour is deep brown, 7 to 10 minutes
Add onion, garlic, mushrooms, and parsley
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly
Coat a large skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium-high heat
Season pork chops with salt and pepper and brown in the hot pan, 5 to 7 minutes per side
Add gravy mixture from the saucepan
Cover and cook over low heat until tender and no longer pink in the centers, 30 to 40 minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)
